The Computerized File Management System .A Buginas, S.J. Crow, N.B. A file management system can provide a powerful search tool for a library reference group.  The system described produces both current awareness and retrospective searches from several diverse data bases.  The same query language can be used to interrogate all data bases in either on-line or batch mode. Searches can be made for any word, word root, phrase, or number in any part of any entry.  Citations selected by coordination of terms can be either printed or used to custom-make new machine-readable files.  Costs are reasonable; an average batch mode search requires 11 seconds of CDC 6600 time. .X 18	2	1366 34	1	1366 49	1	1366 53	1	1366 59	1	1366 124	1	1366 125	3	1366 145	1	1366 164	1	1366 165	1	1366 202	1	1366 211	1	1366 213	1	1366 224	1	1366 243	1	1366 348	1	1366 378	1	1366 381	1	1366 421	1	1366 440	1	1366 448	1	1366 452	2	1366 453	1	1366 465	1	1366 466	1	1366 467	1	1366 468	1	1366 484	1	1366 490	1	1366 491	1	1366 495	1	1366 506	2	1366 507	1	1366 508	1	1366 510	1	1366 511	2	1366 512	2	1366 514	1	1366 516	1	1366 517	1	1366 518	1	1366 520	1	1366 521	2	1366 522	1	1366 523	2	1366 524	1	1366 526	2	1366 527	1	1366 528	2	1366 529	1	1366 575	1	1366 576	1	1366 580	1	1366 591	1	1366 595	1	1366 603	1	1366 604	2	1366 609	1	1366 610	1	1366 612	2	1366 615	1	1366 619	1	1366 622	2	1366 623	2	1366 625	1	1366 626	1	1366 629	2	1366 631	1	1366 632	1	1366 633	2	1366 636	1	1366 639	1	1366 659	1	1366 676	1	1366 699	1	1366 700	2	1366 705	2	1366 707	2	1366 711	1	1366 722	1	1366 723	2	1366 726	2	1366 727	2	1366 728	2	1366 729	1	1366 730	2	1366 731	2	1366 732	1	1366 754	2	1366 809	1	1366 810	1	1366 812	2	1366 813	2	1366 814	2	1366 817	1	1366 820	2	1366 822	2	1366 824	1	1366 828	1	1366 866	1	1366 870	2	1366 873	1	1366 875	1	1366 879	1	1366 1078	1	1366 1089	1	1366 1091	2	1366 1143	1	1366 1264	1	1366 1283	1	1366 1298	1	1366 1299	1	1366 1302	1	1366 1303	2	1366 1327	1	1366 1363	1	1366 1364	1	1366 1366	6	1366 1367	4	1366 1368	4	1366 1396	2	1366 1396	2	1366
